container-title: • 1979: the United Nations General Assembly adopted an International Convention against the Taking of Hostages; • 1982: the Council of Europe adopted a recommendation about International Cooperation in the Prosecution and Punishment of Terrorism
note: • 2001–2: the United Nations opened for signature an International Convention for the Suppression of Terrorism.
title: the Helsinki Declaration of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe, signed by 30 European states, the United States, Canada and the Holy See, pledged members ‘to refrain from direct or indirect assistance to terrorist activities’; • 1977: the Council of Europe opened for signature a European Convention on the Suppression of Terrorism

Teheran – US embassy staff taken hostage by Islamic students. President Carter orders abortive rescue. Eventual release after two months
Ireland – IRA kill Lord Mountbatten by bombing his fishing boat
Bologna – Right wing group bomb station
Munich – Right wing group bomb Oktoberfest, killing 14
Ramstein, West Germany – Red Army explode bomb at US Air Force base
London – IRA car bomb decimates troop of mounted Lifeguards
Beirut – Islamic Jihad suicide car bomb, at US and French barracks
Beirut – US embassy hit by truck bomb
India – Sikh terrorists seize Amritsar’s Golden Temple
Lebanon – Terry Waite, Archbishop of Canterbury’s envoy, abducted until
Torrejon, Spain – Hizbullah bomb restaurant near US base
Brighton – IRA bomb fails to kill Prime Minister Thatcher and Cabinet at conference

container-title: Hostages held in Beirut until President Reagan yields
title: Beirut, Algiers – Rome–Cairo plane hijacked by Hizbullah and flown to Beirut, to Algiers and back to Beirut. Intense diplomatic efforts to secure release of passengers and crew
East Mediterranean – Palestinians seize Italian cruise liner Achille Lauro, taking 700 hostages. One dies. Egypt offers terrorists sanctuary in return for passengers’ release
West Berlin – Libyan bomb attack on café popular with GIs. 81 casualties. US military jets retaliate by strafing Tripoli, Quaddafi’s capital
Jerusalem – Hamas suicide bombers bomb shops, killing eight
Ulster – IRA bomb in Omagh kills 29, injures 330, despite ceasefire
Colombia – National Liberation Army bomb pipeline
Yemen – al-Qaida bombs USS Cole, killing 17, wounding 40

– two hijacked planes demolish World Trade Center twin towers. Pentagon bombed. One other plane misses, perhaps White House target, crashes in Pennsylvania. Worst ever disaster – nearly 3,000 die. US builds ambitious anti-terrorist programme, and forms a global coalition against terrorism

note: investigations, point to disgruntled US scientist as source.
title: United States – United States and other countries have suspect anthrax spores in mail. Some deaths, hoaxes abound
Tel Aviv – Hamas bomb nightclub, injuring 140
Jerusalem, Haifa – Palestinians use car bombs; savage Israeli retaliation
Philippines – nail bomb kills three, leads to great panic
Bali – al-Qaida bombs nightclub. 187 die, 300 injured, many of them tourists
Kuwait – shooting of US soldiers on training exercise; suicide bombing of French army base
Manila – Abu Sayyaf Islamic group bomb shops
Moscow – Chechen terrorists, 50 of them, take 700 hostages in a theatre audience. Rescue attempt kills all the Chechens but gas used in storming the building kills 90 of the hostages
Kashmir – Islamic militants shoot into bazaar crowd
Jerusalem – Hamas suicide bomber kills 11 and injures 50
Mombasa, Kenya – al-Qaida bomb hotel. 13 die, 80 injured, many of them tourists
West Bank mortar attack by Hamas partly averted by security forces, 10 injured
